content.content: ARC - Rollout Progress Tracker - This Dashboard includes several queries which can be used for tracking the progress of Arc rollout

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Count of all Servers
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| summarize ServerCount = count()

partHeader.title: All Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Count of Servers registered to Arc

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Physical Core Count
partHeader.subtitle: Count of all Cores

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Provisioned Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Servers where Provisioning State = "Succeeded"

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Connected Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Servers where Status is "Success"

content.content:
Connected and Provisioned VMs Fully activated Arc connected Servers have a positive connection & provisioning status. Total Connected & Provisioned VMs should ideally equal Total VMs
.

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: All Windows Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Count of Windws Servers registered to Arc

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.subtitle: Count of Windws Servers Cores registered to Arc

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Provisioned Windows Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Windows Servers where Provisioning State = "Success"

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Connected Windows Servers
partHeader.subtitle: WIndows Servers where which have a "connected" status

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
//Arc registered VMs (Windows & linux)
| where type == "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines"
//Boolean - SQL installed (true/false)
| extend mssqlDiscovered = properties.mssqlDiscovered
| where mssqlDiscovered == 'true'
| summarize ServerCount = count()

partHeader.title: All Servers with SQL Server Discovered
partHeader.subtitle: Count of Servers where SQL Server has been discovered

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: All Servers with SQL Agent installed
partHeader.subtitle: Count of Servers with SQL Agent Installed

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: All Servers with at least one SQL Instance
partHeader.subtitle: Servers with MSSQLServer Discovered and at least 1 instance of SQL Server

content.content:
SQL Instance Metrics 3 requirements for completed SQL Server Instance registration
  1. SQL Server Discovered on Server
  2. SQL Server Agent installed correctly
  3. At least 1 SQL Server Instance registered
These 3 metrics will be equal if all SQL Servers have been registered correctly

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances'
| summarize SQLInstanceCount = count()

partHeader.title: Total SQL Server Instances
partHeader.subtitle: VMs can host multiple SQL Server Instances

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: All Servers with SQL Server Ent/Std
partHeader.subtitle: Total VMs with at least one instance of Standard or Enterprisre Edition

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: Total SQL Server VMs with Paid License Type
partHeader.subtitle: Count of all SQL Server VMs with Ent/Std and Paid License Type

content.content: SQL License Type Tracks the setting of the SQL Server License Type

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
| where  type == "microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances/databases"
| summarize countDBs = count()

partHeader.title: Total SQL Server DBs
partHeader.subtitle: Count of all DBs across all Instances

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances'
| extend provisioningState = tostring(properties.provisioningState)
| extend status = tostring(properties.status)
| where provisioningState == "Succeeded"
| summarize succeedededProvisioningInstanceCount = count()

partHeader.title: Provisioned SQL Servers
partHeader.subtitle: Count of Instances provisioned

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
resources
| where type == 'microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances'
| extend provisioningState = tostring(properties.provisioningState)
| extend status = tostring(properties.status)
| where status == "Connected"
| summarize connectedInstanceCount = count()

partHeader.title: Connected SQL Server Instances
partHeader.subtitle: Count of Instances connected fully to Arc

content.content: Connected and Provisioned Instances Windows & Linux VMs can host multiple SQL Server Instances and so the total number of SQL Instances can exceed the number of SQL VMs(Servers with SQL Server discovered). Total Connected & Provisioned instances should ideally equal Total SQL Server Instances

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Arc Queries - All Windows Servers by Subscription, Resource Group, Type
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend CoreCount = toint (properties.detectedProperties.logicalCoreCount)
| extend OSVersion = tostring(properties.osSku)
| extend ESUAttached = iff(properties.licenseProfile.esuProfile.esuKeyState =="Inactive", 0, 1)
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
| project subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion, ESUAttached, CoreCount
| summarize ServerCount = count()  by subscriptionName
| order by subscriptionName

partHeader.title: Servers onboarded by Subscription
partHeader.subtitle: Total Servers onboarded to Arc by Subscription

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Arc Queries - All Windows Servers by Location
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend CoreCount = toint (properties.detectedProperties.logicalCoreCount)
| extend OSVersion = tostring(properties.osSku)
| extend ESUAttached = iff(properties.licenseProfile.esuProfile.esuKeyState =="Inactive", 0, 1)
| extend location = tostring(tags.Location)
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
| project subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion, ESUAttached, CoreCount, location
| summarize ServerCount = count() by location
| order by location

partHeader.title: Servers onboarded by Location
partHeader.subtitle: Total Servers onboarded to Arc by Location

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
//Servers by OS Version
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend OSVersion = tostring(properties.osSku)
| project OSVersion
| summarize ServerCount = count() by OSVersion
| order by ServerCount desc

partHeader.title: Servers by OS
partHeader.subtitle: Servers on Arc by OS Version

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Arc Queries - All Windows Servers by Subscription, Resource Group, Type
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend CoreCount = toint (properties.detectedProperties.logicalCoreCount)
| extend OSVersion = tostring(properties.osSku)
| extend ESUAttached = iff(properties.licenseProfile.esuProfile.esuKeyState =="Inactive", 0, 1)
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
| project subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion, ESUAttached, CoreCount
| summarize ServerCount = count()  by subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion

partHeader.title: Servers -Summary
partHeader.subtitle: All Servers by Subscription, Resource Group, OS Version

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Run query to see results.
resources
| where type == "microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances"
//| wheretype== "microsoft.hybridcompute/machines"
//| whereproperties.detectedProperties.mssqldiscovered== "true"
| extend d=parse_json(properties)
| extend Patch=d["patchLevel"]
| extend SQLVersion=tostring(d["version"])
| extend  Edition=d["edition"]
| extend License=d["licenseType"]
| project name, Patch, SQLVersion, Edition, License
| summarize SQLServerVersionCount=count() by SQLVersion
| order by SQLServerVersionCount desc

partHeader.title: SQL Server by Version
partHeader.subtitle: SQL Servers on Arc hosted servers by SQL Version

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: SQL Server License Type for Enterprise & Standard
partHeader.subtitle: Summary of SQL License Type settings across all Ent & Std SQL Servers

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query

partHeader.title: SQL Server License Type Settings by Subscription, Resource Group for Enterprise & Standard
partHeader.subtitle: Breakdown of SQL Server License Type settings for "production" SQL Servers

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Arc Queries - All Windows Servers by Subscription, Resource Group, Type
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend CoreCount = toint (properties.detectedProperties.logicalCoreCount)
| extend OSVersion = tostring(properties.osSku)
| extend ESUAttached = iff(properties.licenseProfile.esuProfile.esuKeyState =="Inactive", 0, 1)
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
| project subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion, ESUAttached, CoreCount
| summarize ServerCount = count() , TotalCores = sum(CoreCount), TotalESU =sum(ESUAttached) by subscriptionName, resourceGroup, OSVersion

partHeader.title: Servers -Summary
partHeader.subtitle: All Servers by Subscription, Resource Group, OS Version

inputs.name: partTitle
inputs.value: Query 1

inputs.name: query
inputs.value:
// Run query to see results.
resources
| where type == "microsoft.azurearcdata/sqlserverinstances"
| extend d=parse_json(properties)
| extend Patch=d["patchLevel"]
| extend SQLVersion=d["version"]
| extend  Edition=d["edition"]
| extend License=d["licenseType"]
| join kind=inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project subscriptionId, subscriptionName = name)
    on subscriptionId
| project subscriptionName, resourceGroup, Patch, SQLVersion, Edition, License
| summarize ServerCount=count() by subscriptionName, resourceGroup, tostring(SQLVersion)

partHeader.title: SQL Servers -Summary
partHeader.subtitle: All Servers by Subscription, Resource Group, Version
